boat.name: Sallie
boat.full_description:
Colchester smack 'Sallie' was built in 1907 by Aldous of Brightlingsea for the Bowles family from Tollesbury. She was registered for oyster dredging and stow boating for sprats. She operated in the Thames Estuary until 1951 when her ownership passed to Peter Light, one of the last sailing bargemen. He operated 'Sallie' as a charter boat before passing her on to the Sea Scouts.

In 1974 the owner wrote to the OGA Newsletter to say he is forced to sell against his will because he could no longer do the work needed on the hull, she was lying in Whitby at the time where she remained as a hulk near the harbour wall until 1981.

She returned to Essex with her owner in 1981 where she underwent an extensive restoration, remaining engineless and having traditional cotton sails. She was relaunched in 1989 and in 2000 she sailed to l’Aberwrach, Brest and Douarnenez festivals.
boat.short_description: 'Sallie' is a Class 2 smack, built in 1907 by Aldous of Brightlingsea. She is one of only a small number of Colchester smacks still sailed in the traditional manner, without an engine.
